He writes daily reports on our dogs' activities and also takes care of your mail/plants/others as needed.  In addition, our dogs love seeing Tim whenever he walks into the apartment -- this gives us a tremendous peace of mind when we have to leave them home.  We highly recommend Tim for pet-sitting services.

text: So here the deal. I have lived in Rhode Island for 22 years (I‚Äôm 22 lol) and I have traveled the country in search of the best chicken sandwhichs the United States have to offer me. I‚Äôve worked with a chick filet chain, and I go as far back as making my own dorm resteraunt circulated around selling organic beautifully fried chicken sandwhiches, so I take chicken sandwhiches very seriously. When I tell you that this establishment is essentially top 5 sandwhich/drinks joints in the country I don‚Äôt exaggerate. This place makes me proud to be from Rhode Island. The Food is magical. If your not coming here to eat you are missing out on the best of the human experience. Art is the man and he will make you feel like family. If your reading this please go and eat here, and if you don‚Äôt like the food, I‚Äôll Venmo you ten bucks.

text:
This place is the quintessential hole in the wall location. Hidden on the street corner, the entrance is the corner of the building. Once you open the door, you are greeted with the excellent aroma of pork (and other) pies. The counter area is about 8x8 feet. Cozy and friendly.
Having lived in Scotland, I longed for their pork pies sold at local football (soccer) games. Hartley‚Äôs makes them just as I remember.
We go there when we can. Their limited hours makes it less frequent than I like.
Excellent pies. You have to try them.

text: As soon as we walk in, everyone is very friendly and most of the staff know our dog‚Äôs name even though we have only been going there for about a month. The inside of the building is clean and cute; we love that it looks like a little lodge and that the dogs are ‚Äúcampers.‚Äù We also like the cameras in the yard so we can check on our pup, and the many services Camp Bow Wow offers in addition to daycare and boarding. Everything is very organized and the process of pick up and drop off goes smoothly. They really care about the dogs there, so much so that they do an interview to make sure your dog will get along well with other dogs and get the most of his or her camp experience. The staff is dedicated and seems to know all their campers names. It‚Äôs also super affordable! We love Camp Bow Wow!

text: Food was VERY good, probably the best my husband and I ever had. The waiter was ABSOLUTLEY HORRIBLE!!! HE took our drink order very rudely asking what we wanted-- acting like he was doing us a favor. We advised him it was our first time there and if he had any recommendations, then he basically walked away leaving us to "guess" what we wanted for dinner. Every time we tried to talk to him he answered with one word sentences like he was too busy. Although he had quite a long conversation with the patrons at the tables on either side of us, he acted like we didnt exist. The bus boy delivered us our meal! At that point we finished up and took our food to go. I never saw a smile on the waiters face until he dropped off the check. (Probably because he wanted the tip) we assumed from previous comments on this site that unless you are a regular, you are treated badly from the staff.  WE WOULD NEVER, EVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE OR GO THERE AGAIN! too bad since the food was so delicious

text:
We could not be happier with the service  received from Matt. It took us almost a year to find our perfect (and very specific) boat. Matt was diligent in scouring the listings and constantly kept in touch to let us know of potential prospects and other to offer alternatives.   He never lost sight of our goals and budget or in finding our perfect  catamaran. During the closing process, I am not sure it would‚Äôve ever happened if Matt hadn‚Äôt been so on top of things with everyone involved.   He is awesome to work with and really cares about his clients.
Life is a breeze with the wind in your sail and Matt at your back.

text: Matt LeDuc is an unbelievable broker - the best I've every worked with for any purpose. He is very responsive, deeply knowledgable, extremely fair, and especially easy to work with. Also, he has proved to be an invaluable resource for a variety of needs (surveyors, shippers, marine electricians, and more). He made the entire sales process streamlined and pleasant(!). I trust his judgment implicitly and highly recommend him.

text:
I received a gift card for $75. I looked at the menu saw they had a paint reconditioning service. Decided I would get this service.....   Let me add my paint is not bad at all. I‚Äôve gotten compliments on how well my paint looks for the year of the car.
Just from calling to make an appointment I wasn‚Äôt happy. Apparently when you get this service you have to get a wax coating done. That is an extra $49 dollar charge. I asked if I could do this on my own. Not allowed! So why not just make the service $125 which is came out to!? It‚Äôs the gimmick how they bring you in. Okay fine I‚Äôll pay the extra. Upon calling and finding out about these extra charges I made an appointment for 12 o‚Äôclock. Arrived 5 minutes early. No parking no attendant/worker to be found. Finally I park near the vacuums then check in.
Didn‚Äôt seem to care I had an appointment. Got the same speech I got on the phone ‚ÄúTypically takes 2-21/2 hours some times longer. Okay fine with me 3 hours or so. Nope!! After 4 hours I called and got ‚Äúyour detailer says it will be ready for 4:30‚Äù I arrive at 4:30 car is sitting outside looking good. No one around garage doors shut! I do a once around looks decent not going to complain. Yes they pulled some surfaces scratches out but that was about all.
So 41/2 hours later to do a job I could have done at home in about the same time. The following day I had a car show i was attending. Part of why I chosethis service to save me a day of work. I walk out the next morning and start noticed excess wax spots. I work those spots in.
Unfortunately it rained during the car show and in my travels. It‚Äôs now two days later there is white all over!! Seems it was rushed.

So my final say is if you are going to get a cut and buff service find a good auto body shop. It will cost you the same. Maybe a little more but it won‚Äôt turn out how this has.

I will say after these issues. I did work with the manager and asst manager and got these resolved. so my review remains the same on the work. Customer satisfaction I will give 5 stars

business.name: ScrubaDub Car Wash
business.address: ScrubaDub Car Wash, 1390 Bald Hill Rd, Warwick, RI 02886

text: Great place to get swole as HECK! Very clean and orderly with a staff that's extremely helpful. It's open 24/5, sat & sun they are not open 24 hours. I usually go during the week after 11pm and it's usually only 3 other people in the gym. Way awesome to have minimal human contact! You can either get the $10/month plan and stick to one gym location or the $20 a month plan and you can go to any location! Just know that there's a 40 something dollar a year fee for both memberships. Well worth it though!

text:
I've had it on my radar for a while but never make it over this way. With most or all items locally sourced you can't help but love this quaint brunch spot. I ordered off the specials menu, the country gravy Benedict with a side of dressed greens, had to get a little greens on my plate ^_^. It was phenomenal. My husband ordered the biscuits and gravy which was also super tasty. Everything on the menu sounded amazing it took us a good 15 minutes to make our final decision. Molly our server was spectacular. Finally got to try Nitro Carts nitro brew and it was heavenly as I hoped it would be. Do yourself a flavor and have brunch, lunch, or dinner here, you wont be disappointed.

Just an FYI they don't have home fries, they're hash browns. For all those home fry lovers like my husband. Don't let the menu fool you.

text: As they say in real estate, location is the key. The Courtyard could not be better situated for ALL needs- convention hall convenience, shopping, attractiveness of the location with the parks, downtown business, and nearby restaurants. Also, the main public bus, Amtrak trains, and the local train to Boston as well as many of the major sites such as Brown University, museums and the small National Park Museum in the downtown area are within walking distance if you can walk uphill. The walk from the Amtrak station is a very easy flat surface sidewalk. You really do not need a car in Providence and so this is a wonderful convenience. The sightseeing trolley will take you all over the city and so you can see the areas that are too far to walk to.

text: Grew up in the area and Narragansett beach is the place to be in the summer if you want to get some sun and take in the ambiance.  If you want to make a day of it get here early, parking fills up fast.  The water is sectioned off for swimmers and surfers, please be aware to avoid injury and learn proper wave etiquette to avoid dropping in on the person who has the right of way.  Lastly, please be mindful of others and bring out what you brought in.

text: I have been coming here for years. It was one of my favorite places to eat. I had ordered a rice bowl and the waitress accidentally brought me a noodle bowl ( I have a gluten allergy) so I very kindly asked her for the rice bowl again. When the rice bowl finally came out there was a piece of hair that was blatantly and deliberately placed right on top. I have worked in restaurants before and I know how some chefs react to food being returned to the kitchen. Absolutely disgusting.
